definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: And btw, all the Chinese Pollutionfigures are fudged.
sentences.chinese: 顺便提一句，所有有关中国污染的诗句都是捏造的。

sentences.english: Su reading a poem "the wild around the water chestnut wheat demand, strong as a mountain soup cooking shag."
sentences.chinese: 读苏东坡诗句“时绕麦田求野荠，强为僧舍煮山羹。”

sentences.english: It is concerned more with verse than prose and represents the Poetics of Gongorism.
sentences.chinese: 它更多关注诗句而非散文，代表了贡戈拉流派的诗学。

sentences.english: Ancient poetry word middle have the verse "translating" the sum "day lily"?
sentences.chinese: 古诗词中有“译”和“萱”的诗句么？

sentences.english: He quotes a few verses from Tennyson in his paper.
sentences.chinese: 论文中引用了英国诗人丁尼生的几行诗句。

sentences.english: He permits his own unconstrained indulgence in poetic enjambment.
sentences.chinese: 他放任自己无限制的使用连结体诗句。

sentences.english: It seems to me that Constance also knew about the verses .
sentences.chinese: 看起来康斯坦斯也打听到诗句的事。

sentences.english: These lines are lifted from Wordsworth.
sentences.chinese: 这些诗句是从渥兹华斯那剽窃来的。

sentences.english: In all five elegies the construction of the verses follows an alphabetical arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 在所有五个挽歌建设的诗句如下一个字母安排。

sentences.english: The apt citations and poetic gems have adorned his speeches.
sentences.chinese: 贴切的引语和珠玑般的诗句为他的演说词增添文采。

sentences.english: He recorded his emotion in elegiac lines of magnificent dignity .
sentences.chinese: 他把他的感情宣泄在凄惋而庄严的诗句里。

sentences.english: The apt citations and poetic gems have adorned his speeches .
sentences.chinese: 贴切的引语和珠玑般的诗句为他的演说词增添文采。

sentences.english: In verse the oracles divine were heard.
sentences.chinese: 神的旨谕在诗句中频显现。

sentences.english: I would love to burn my poem with immortalized love.
sentences.chinese: 我愿用永生之爱，燃烧我的诗句。

sentences.english: The poet ranted his humorous verses before a big crowd.
sentences.chinese: 这位诗人在大庭广众之下大声朗诵他的幽默诗句。

sentences.english: Now most rhymed poems in Milton's day were end-stopped lines of verse.
sentences.chinese: 弥尔顿时期的大部分押韵诗都使用孤联诗句。

definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line
Du Fu (712-770), great Tang dynasty poet
